terms.definition: A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems within an organization
Written materials that provide information, instructions, or explanations about processes, procedures, or systems
A sequence of processes or steps that work follows from initiation to completion, often automated or systematized for efficiency
The process of organizing, storing, and maintaining digital content to ensure it remains accessible, current, and useful
The process by which users begin to use and integrate a new system, tool, or technology into their regular work practices
Long-term storage systems for preserving important information and documents that may be needed for future reference
The practice of adding descriptive keywords or labels to content to improve searchability and organization
Groups of people with different functional expertise working toward a common goal, represented in the article as 'move-practical groups'
A systematic approach to dealing with the transition or transformation of organizational processes, systems, or technologies
Information provided by users about their experience with a system or process, used to improve functionality and usability
The process of putting a system, plan, or technology into effect and making it operational within an organization
A central location where data, documents, or information is stored and maintained for easy access and management
The practice of exchanging information, skills, and expertise among individuals or teams within an organization
The systematic arrangement and structuring of information to make it easily discoverable and usable by intended audiences
Periods when systems, equipment, or processes are not operational, often used as a metric for measuring efficiency improvements
